summary: The Driver Technology and Pedestrian Safety Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Transportation to study the impact of driver-controlled technology, particularly touch screen-based systems, on traffic injuries and fatalities. The study will be conducted in partnership with the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine and will investigate factors like driver distraction, user interface design, and comparisons with smartphone use. The Secretary is required to submit a report to Congress with findings and recommendations to reduce severe traffic injuries and fatalities, including proposed changes to existing data collection systems.
